fields.description:
h6. Steps to Reproduce:
* Create 2 projects. Project A and Project B
* Create a custom label field which is available to both Project A and B.
!3.png|thumbnail!
* Let's have two users. User A with Browse project permission to Project A only and User B who has Browse Project permission to both Project A and B. 
* Create an issue in either one of the projects and fill up the custom label field.
* Login as User A and go to the issue detail page.
* Click the custom label field *value* and the user will be directed to the issue navigator.
* It will show an error "A value with ID '10000' does not exist for the field 'project'.

h6. Expected Behaviour:
* JIRA should generate a JQL which is aligned to the permission granted to the user currently logged in. It shouldn't include a project ID where the user has no permission with. When you login as User B who has permission on both projects. No error was noted.
!2.png|thumbnail!

h6. Actual Behaviour:
* An error was thrown when User A clicks on the custom label field value.
!1.png|thumbnail!

h6. Workaround:
* Remove the project ID shown on the error from the JQL.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't respect Project Permission in Generating JQL
Custom Fields not used by specific issue types still show in issue navigator column configuration

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) created a dashboard
2) share to some group
3) delete this group

Now the dashboard has only 'Tools' menu, but no ability to add gadgets etc.

Expected:
1) Dashboard still editable
2) In 'Manage Dashboards' page in 'Shared With' column a notification that group is non-existing.
fields.summary: Dashboard becomes unconfigurable after the shared group is deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46376].
  {panel}

When I'm navigating to a project via the projects menu, I expect to end up at the issues list for that project.

*Current behaviour:*
- Click on projects menu and subsequently on a project
- sometimes end up at {{/projects/<PROJ>/issues}} views, often end up at {{/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?...}}

*Expected behaviour:*
- Click on projects menu and subsequently on a project
- end up at {{/projects/<PROJ>/issues}} consistently

*Sidenote:*
When visiting a {{/project/<PROJ>/issues}} page, subsequent visits to that project from the Projects menu seem to end up at the issues list for that project.
fields.summary: Project Menu items redirect to Agile/Kanban boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46374].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Date picker in JIRA Calendar defaults to previous day

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Include the {{Due Date}} field on a ticket screen
# Click the Calendar icon

h3. Expected Results
Calendar should highlight the current date

h3. Actual Results
Calendar highlights the previous day while the current day is in bold text

h3.Workaround
No work around other than selecting the day that is in bold text if the current day is needed.
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar defaults to previous day in date picker

fields.description:
Upgrading Jira from 6.3.x to 6.4.x gave us the "new project navigation".  Additionally we had disabled inline editing from the Administration --> System --> General Configuration.

Inline editing is still disabled and respected in all views that existed prior to the upgrade.

However, in the "new project navigation" view, the Issues browser there does not respect the global setting and allows inline editing anyway.
fields.summary: "new project nagivation" Issues browser doesn't respect global Inline edit setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46371].
  {panel}

1. We were trying to create a workflow yesterday(Nov 09) 
2. Suddenly the following error started appearing whenever we try to access workflows for any project:
"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
3. We tried creating a workflow from Project Administration-> Issues->workflows but the workflow is not getting saved
fields.summary: Workflow Error :The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.

fields.description:
* I've created a few different Issue Collectors each with their own Issue Type as you can see in the 'Issue Collectors' screenshot.
* I then went and used the Issue Collectors to create some issues under each of the them.
* As you can see in the 'Bug issue Collector' screenshot the Recent Issues Issue Types are correctly displaying the Bug Issue Type.
* If you look at the Improvement or Feedback Issue Collectors you can see that the Issue Type under the Details does not match the Recent Issues Issue Type.
** This only ever displays the Bug Issue Type.
* If you click on 'View all # issues in issue Navigator' you can see that the correct Issue Types have been created.
** I've also attached screenshots for all the Issue Types and appended 'Filter' to them.
* The Issue is that on the Issue Collector page the Issue Type is incorrect under Recent Issues.
fields.summary: Issue Collectors: Recent Issues Always Show As Bugs

fields.description:
*SUMMARY:*
While adding workflow to workflow scheme ZOOM WARNING appears each time workflow is selected. It brings up multiple warnings at same time. Those warnings remains (in cache?) even while browser is restarted and andy single zoom warning is triggered (additional appears at same time)

 !WORKFLOW DESIGNER -multiple warnings.png|thumbnail! 

*STEPS TO REPRODUCE:*
# Zoom-in your browser (to trigger warning)
# Administration > Issues > Workflow schemas
# Edit any scheme
# Add Workflow > Add Existing
# Switch between workflows couple of times

*OBSERVED PROBLEM:*
 - Each time workflow is changed warning appears
 - Not closed (X button) are stored and shows up even if browser is restarted.

*ENVIRONMENT:*
 - OS X (Yosemite)
 - CHROME (Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit))
fields.summary: Workflow schemes - Zoom Warning - multiple warnings

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [SSL for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.jirasslplugin] plugin is only compatible with JIRA 7.1 or older versions.

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
*Summary:*
First time any status from diagram is deleted - warning pops-up. Once pop-up is dismissed and delete operation is repeated nothing shows up.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# navigate to: JIRA administration (COG icon) > ISSUES > WORKFLOWS
# Edit Existing workflow
# Select any state
# Press Delete button (warning appears)
# Dismiss warning
# Press Delete button again on selected status

*Observed problem:*
 - Second time Delete button is pressed nothing happens.
 - To see pop-up user need to reload Workflows page again.

*Environment:*
 - OS X (Yosemite)
 - Browser: Chrome (Version 46.0.2490.86 (64-bit))
fields.summary: Workflow designer - Delete button works only one time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46366].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In JIRA, when an user renames a user A and creates a second user B with the previous username, the user A's avatar breaks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Please, to reproduce, follow this instructions exactly as they are, because we found out that small changes prevent us from replicating it. For example, redoing it with the same user (after deleting users from a previous test) doesn’t reproduce this bug.

# Have a clean JIRA instance with default avatar configuration
# Create a user (A) with the following data:
#* Username: user1
#* Email: user1@test.com
#* Name: user1
# Rename user A this way (the email probably doesn’t play a role here, but some instances use the email to set the username, so it may be required to set the username):
#* Username: user2
#* Email: user2@test.com
#* Name: user2
# Create another user (user B) with same username as A had:
#* Username: user1
#* Email: user1@test.com
#* Name: user1
# Log in as user A (currently user2)
# Set a picture as the user’s avatar
#* This error doesn’t happen with the avatars provided by JIRA, you must create an image and set as avatar to reproduce

h3. Expected Results
The avatar is working correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The avatar image is broken, both in Cloud and in Server.

In the user’s profile, we can see these errors in the browser console (Chrome):
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?ownerId=user1&avatarId=11504 Failed to load resource: net::ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
{noformat}

And:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8080/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=1…2Fgadgets%2Factivitystream-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh#rpctoken=499011633 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 410 (Gone)
{noformat}

Copying the image link and trying to open it shows an error page with ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS. The image link is the one in the first error mentioned above (for example, 'https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/useravatar?ownerId=user1&avatarId=11504')

This illustrates:
!missing_avatars.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
*Partial Workaround*
If possible, remove user B to fix user A

*Workaround 2*
Change user B's username to something else

*Important*: _User B is not the affected user_ (that's user A, check 'Steps to Reproduce'). User B is a user whose username is the same as user A's original username. 

If you don't know user A's original username to find user B, you can use this search in the database:
{code:sql}
select user_key from app_user where id = (select id from cwd_user where user_name = 'user2');
{code}

Just replace 'user2' by user A's current username and you'll find the original one, used by the other user.
fields.summary: User's avatar picture is broken if its previous username is used by another user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46365].
{panel}
h3. Summary

The documentation for New line in CSV external import in JIRA doesn't work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and save a CSV file as per the documentation *[Importing Data From CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/importing-data-from-csv-185729516.html]*
{noformat}
Summary, Description, Status
"Login fails", "This is on
a new line", Open
{noformat}

 # Do a CSV import in JIRA using the *External Import in JIRA*

h3. Expected Results

Issue created to have multiple line in it's _Description_ field.
h3. Actual Results

Imported issue is in one line rather than multiple lines.
{noformat}
"Login fails", "This is ona new line", Open
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

On the *Map fields* screen, map your incoming field to the appropriate Jira field, but _do not_ tick the *Map field value* checkbox. Ticking this box takes you to a screen where your browser will strip out your extra formatting.

Depending on the formatting of your data and the field it's importing into, you may also want to wrap your incoming comment in \{noformat} tags.
h3. Workaround #2

It is possible to create newlines by using:
{noformat}
\\ {noformat}
at the beginning of each line as per the example below:
{noformat}
Summary,Type,Description,Status
"next csv new line test","Bug","Atlassian
\\ Testing Issue
\\ Acceptance Criteria
\\ - Line 1
\\ - Line 2
\\ - Line 3
\\ - Line 4",To Do
{noformat}
(!) However, this workaround creates another issue with the exported field as mentioned in this bug ticket: *JRA-46364*
fields.summary: New line in CSV external import in JIRA doesn't work

h3. Problem Definition
Users are able to log work on issue whenever they want causing logs to be inaccurate
h3. Suggested Solution
Add configuration to disable log work after a period of time
h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Email with High priority does not create issue in higher priority, as per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-749383405.html] 
bq. If the incoming email is set to a high priority, the corresponding issue will be created with a higher priority than the default priority that is set in your JIRA system

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core 7.0.0
* Outlook as email server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the "Priorities" page and set "Medium" as the Default Priority.
# Configure a POP / IMAP Mail Server
# Configure a Mail Handler
# Send an email with *Normal* priority 
# Send another email with *High* priority 
# Send another email with *Low* priority 
# Monitor the priority of the created issues

h3. Expected Results
Email with High priority will create issue with higher priority than the default priority

h3. Actual Results
All issues are created with the default priority
 
h3. Notes
Email header
{code:borderStyle=solid}
X-TMN: [HlnVq3QLQlsE4HQp/1sUNCR7PRlthp4y]
X-Originating-Email: [example@hotmail.com]
Message-ID: <BLU171-W117DA9C7E7434F4B6A0AD44AF120@phx.gbl>
Return-Path: example@hotmail.com
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="_ba10e5ad-caf8-4b56-a03a-8ece2b2a72dc_"
From: =?Windows-1252?B?dmluZXNoIJk=?= <example@hotmail.com>
To: "example2@outlook.com" <example2@outlook.com>
Subject: test11
Date: Thu, 12 Nov 2015 16:35:45 +0800
Importance: High
MIME-Version: 1.0
{code}
fields.summary: Email with High priority does not create issue with higher priority

fields.description:
Hi,

when we do excel exports of issues from advanced search page in jira for the stories and select columns like estimated time and other time related fields to export, then jira export plugin convert time format from hours to seconds.
this issue is really very annoying as most of users do excel exports for analysis of jira issues its very important for us to keep the time format same in jira and in excel during export.

can you please provide us a solution for this Bug?

Thanks,
Pawan
fields.summary: Jira Export to xls changes format for columns related to Time( hours to seconds)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Current version of JIRA (cloud or server) only use favicon. Unfortunately Apple choose <link rel="mask-icon" ...> for icon rendered inside pinned tabs.

Please add proper configuration for this into JIRA (cloud if possible and server) similar to favicon configuration.

Related info:
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/pinnedTabs/pinnedTabs.html
fields.summary: Add mask-icon for Safari Pinned Tab icon

h3. Summary
Linked issue information doesn't displayed in queue list at *Links* column when linking between different JIRA 7 , not in the same instance .

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7
* JIRA Service Desk 3 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link JIRA A with JIRA B
# Then create a service desk issue at JIRA A , then link with issue at JIRA B
# Create *New Queue* at JIRA Service Desk project at JIRA A . Make sure to display *Link* column.
# Check at the information for earlier issue created . Link issue information should display at the queue , but is not showing.

h3. Expected Results
# Issue information in queue shows *Links* information

h3. Actual Results
# Issue information in queue doesn't shows *Links* information
fields.summary: Linked issue information doesn't displayed in queue list when linking between different JIRA 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46287].
  {panel}

We have 4 Jira servers each with over 900 custom fields. And hundreds of projects each with their own customized field configuration. When adding a new custom field to the server it automatically adds these fields to all the field configurations and makes it visible. This makes the field show in the search view, and the excel export view. 

This means that when data is exported from an issue type that should have only 12 fields. the excel file actually has 900 columns in the file making the exported data worthless. Additionally the search only shows 10 or so fields so if you don't know all the available fields it is near impossible to decide which columns you want to show in the search results. or which fields you want to search for. 

We know that we could go in to all the field configurations and hide all the unused fields for all these. However the problem is when a project has a new requirement and adds a new custom field then the field automatically becomes visible in all projects. 

The default behavior should be changed when new fields are added. or at very least allow the person creating the field decide which projects to apply the field to.
fields.summary: Custom Fields are not hidden by default
Problem with images into icons
Custom Issue Collector fields are duplicated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46283].
  {panel}

I am using JIRA Cloud and noticed that components are sorted by ASCII order, not alphabetical order, when determining the default assignee of a newly created bug. This contradicts the documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/defining-a-component-185729533.html . That documentation states:

```
If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
```

Reproduction steps:

1. Create a component called 'a'
2. Create a component called 'B'
3. Assign Person 1 as the default assignee for component 'a'.
4. Assign Person 2 as the default assignee for component 'B'.
5. Create a new bug that affects both the 'a' and 'B' components.
6. Person 2 is now the assignee for the bug, rather than the expected Person1.
fields.summary: When determining default assignee, components are sorted by ASCII order, not alphabetically as documented.

Ctrl+V shortcut does not paste into Summary field on IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46276].
  {panel}

Suggestion: Add ability to @mention all people in custom User Picker type fields in an issue

We use custom "User Picker" type fields to define 1 working group member from a number of different groups that works on a particular issue. For example, a tech writer, a web developer, a QC, instructional designer, etc. (This is not defined at the project level, but at the issue level). 

When using commenting to @mention we almost always have to look under the "People" area  in the issue and see who all the people are on the issue, and then tag them individually with with @mentions. (Using "watch" is not feasible, it generates far too many emails and is not used, plus, there isn't a separate possibility to simply @mention watchers, now is there?)

Commentary on Atlasssian and the Usefulness of Voting
Of course, I now realize that no matter how many votes a suggestion gets here, it stands about as a great a chance of being implemented in Jira as a flea bench lifting a car, but we have to keep trying, eh? Just look at the top voted issues here, and you'll see the the majority of them have been poo-poo'd by Atlassian. This doesn't build customer confidence in your ability to democratically gather feedback. But there's always a glimmer of hope, after voting for many of the most popular suggestions here, 1 of them actually went into production! Hooray!
fields.summary: @mention people (User Picker fields) on this issue
ffsg

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46274].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently, if administrators install plugins during a peak period, when many users are active on the instance, it may have severe impact on performance and even accessibility of core functionality.

The reason for this partly is having related caches reset globally, which can be a cascade operation, not only affecting the caches related to the very plugin being upgraded, but others dependent on it. This may have the effect of the instance being locked up for 10+ minutes even, depending on the number of active user sessions and the caches affected

h4. Workaround
Based on the facts above, we suggest not to implement major configuration changes during peak-hours. Make sure to schedule such major changes to off-peak hours (overnight or during weekend), when user activity on the instance is minimal.

h4. Proposed solution
One possible solution would be to block/reject incoming user requests during plugin installation/upgrade, to have the impacted period around 30s instead of minutes.
fields.summary: Make hot plugin installation/upgrade less distruptive
Different MS SQL Driver Version Listed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46229].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you create a new project using the *Create with shared configuration* as described here:
- [Configuring workflow schemes | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-workflow-schemes-776636598.html]
- [Defining a project | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-project-776636280.html]

And attempt to SET the Project Key changing it from the automatically generated key on creation as lowercase letters the KEY will show as uppercase in the field but the page will blank out then reset, and not allow you to set the KEY

h3. Environment
* JIRA CLOUD v7.0.0-OD-08-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Projects* {{https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all}}
# Select *Create New Project*
# Select *Create with shared configuration*
# Choose a Project
# NEXT
# Name It *"Project A"* and the default KEY will be *"PROJ"*
# Change the KEY from *"PROJ"* to *"proj"* or any other KEY Typing In as lowercase
# Submit

h3. Expected Results
Project Created with the Chosen KEY

h3. Actual Results
Fails to Create, Page will blank out, and reset values to default UPPERCASE *"PROJ"* and removes settings for project lead

h3.Workaround
Hold SHIFT or use CapsLock while entering text to the KEY Field
fields.summary: Creating New Project with Create with shared configuration errors when changing KEY using lowercase

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46228].
  {panel}

1. We were trying to create a workflow yesterday(Nov 09) 
2. Suddenly the following error started appearing whenever we try to access workflows for any project:
"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
3. We tried creating a workflow from Project Administration-> Issues->workflows but the workflow is not getting saved
fields.summary: Workflow Error :The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46227].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When attempting to move an issue between projects (using the "Move" link in the "More" dropdown on the view issue page), the move will not work; it fails on the first step stating "The issue type selected is invalid".


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* JIRA Cloud
# Start a clean JIRA Cloud with Software and Service Desk
#* Only ‘Epic’ and ‘Story’ are available
#* They’re both in the Default Issue Type Scheme
# Create a Task Management project
# The issue types ‘Task’ and ‘Sub-tasks’ are created
# Moving issues to ‘Task’ Doesn’t work

* JIRA Server
# install JIRA7 software
# create a Business Project of Process Management type (PROCESS)
# create a Software Project of Scrum type (SCRUM)
# create issue in PROCESS, issuetype=Task
# try to move issue above into SCRUM project, issuetype=Bug
# you will get the error attached. Choose SCRUM project, issuetype=Story works fine

h3. Expected Results

The issue is allowed to be moved to the new project with a new issue type.

h3. Actual Results

Moving issues to/from affected types show this error:
{noformat}
The issue type selected is invalid.
{noformat}
 
!JIRA7 Move Error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

This is not restricted to the issue types listed here. It can also occur when moving to or from custom issue types.

h3.Workaround

You can try moving issues using the bulk edit feature on the issue search page. Follow the instructions for moving issues in [our knowledge-base article on editing multiple issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Editing+multiple+issues+at+the+same+time]

If using bulk edit does not help, you can follow the advice in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error].

Note: JIRA Cloud users experiencing this issue should open a support ticket at [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Move issue error in JIRA software: 'The issue type selected is invalid'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46222].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA Issue Navigatior Printable View has links that do not work when naturally clicked. They can be used when right-clicked, but this is not a very natural experience. Older JIRA Issues mentioned that this was by-design. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Printable view more report like, either remove the links, or perhaps make them work. 
 
h3. Workaround
If you need link functionality, use a right click/middle-click to open the links.
fields.summary: Remove JIRA Issue Navigator Printable View Links

fields.description:

# Create a sub-task.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46219].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

Kindy open a ticket to investigate the below issue. Find that, 2 dimensional gadget filter forgets it filter settings and fall back to user default .. Pls find below for more details


We have discovered what we believe is a 100% repro bug with the actual Atlassian JIRA Gadgets “Issue Statistics” & “Two Dimensional Filter Statistics” gadgets for Dashboards.  Essentially, if you drill-down using the gadgets from the Dashboards (Snip It 1 below - which is surely the intended user path) both gadgets forget their Filters and just enter a basic Search query to return the results.  Thus, each User sees the results in a search and it returns just their local “columns” JIRA settings within their view.  This means the order and fields meant to be displayed by the various Filters driving these gadgets by the creators of the Dashboards at Admin level or User level are lost.  

Also, if you fix it at local level it’s OK provided the User is only accessing one JIRA project on their PC, as if you locally select the correct fields (columns) for one Gadget / Filter, the order then applies to other projects as it’s your local setting, which may not be using the same fields and the Dashboards as they may be showing data for completely different things.  I’ve repro’d this too; Snip It 2 below.

Chris helped isolate the reason being that the drill-down was losing association with the Filter on these 2 gadgets.

As these gadgets are both very useful we will try to raise a request with Atlassian themselves to address; David is doing this.  Just wanted to make you aware in case other teams raise this issue as I spent considerable time trying to resolve as I thought it was something we’d done wrong within our project/dashboards.

If however someone knows another way to ensure Users can see the intended field settings when using these Gadgets, please let us know.

regards

Andy

Snip It 1 (Illustration):  clicking on any of the blue links to drill-down loses the field settings in the search results.

 

Snip It 2 (Illustration):  Drill-down has forgotten the Filter and returned a Search, picking up Users JIRA settings and returning fields not applicable to that specific Filter or Project:


 


Kindly let me know if you need more information on this 

Thanks & Regds

Sandeep Radhakrishnan Warrier
fields.summary: 2 Dimensional gadgets forgets filter settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46212].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When the mail handler picks up an email whose sender is from a JIRA user account, that *does not have Create Issue permissions* in said project, it will throw an error and no issue is created:
{code}
WARN [Test] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ServiceRunner    Test Test[10000]: Reporter (test) does not have permission to create an issue. Message rejected.
{code}
This error obviously makes sense because the user does not have permissions to create issues. But we should allow the option to fall back to using the Default Reporter configured in the mail handler, so theres still an option of creating issues here. 
Technically, the user doesn't have permission to create issues directly in JIRA, but at least have the option of doing it through mail. 

h3. Suggested Solution
A Toggle functionality in the mail handler to choose between:
# Ignore default reporter and prevent issue creation if email is from a user with no Create Issue permission.
# Allow issue to use default reporter and be created in JIRA. 
 
h3. Workaround 
"Trick" jira into thinking these users are anonymous users, (so it will fall back to Default Reporter), e.g. by changing their email addresses in JIRA to a different email. This of course has implications e.g. no notifications can then reach these users.
fields.summary: Toggle between fallback to Default Reporter or preventing issue creation for emails from users with no create issue permission

fields.description:
Please see the attached screenshots.
In the Default Permission Scheme, Browse Projects permission clearly gives the Administrators rights to see the project. In the screenshot, you can see that Administrator can actually See the issue in question in HIRE project. 
But Permission Helper says that Administrator does not have permissions.
fields.summary: Permission Helper returns wrong results JIRA 7.0.0
Provide the ability for Cloud Admins to access application logs
Atlassian Mobile + Firewall

fields.description:
This applies to all Atlassian products that may use the commons collections:
There is a longstanding, unpatched unserialize vulnerability in the commons-collections Java library that allows remote code execution. More details here: http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/#thevulnerability

--

Only JIRA instances with a Data Center license are vulnerable through [ehcache RMI|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center], which is used for clustering, and by default listens on port 40001. Ensure that you only permit cluster nodes to connect to a JIRA Data Center instance's [ehcache RMI port|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center]  through the use of a firewall and/or network segregation.
fields.summary: InvokerTransformer vulnerability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46202].
  {panel}

we often have more than 1 person working an a task, and we have to create the same task twice, one for each person (or in some cases more than 2).
than problem with that is, some people like to only see tasks assigned to them, and they don't see others involved with those tasks.
when this happens, that person may finish up the task before including others that were supposed to be involved. 
if we can tag other people on the task, then everyone will see who needs to be involved before completing the task solo.
fields.summary: tagging users on sub tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Basically, when the default language in JIRA is switch to German and the user profile language is set to English, JIRA will display mix language of English and German in the project administration screen.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.0 (JIRA Core or Software)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default language in JIRA to German (under General Configuration)
# Login in as another user and then set the profile language to English
# Access the project administration screen

h3. Expected Results
The project administration screen display in English language only.

h3. Actual Results
The project administration screen display in mixed language (English and German) [^1.png]
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour is actually a regression from [JRA-28392|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28392].

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround yet.
fields.summary: mixed language in project administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46194].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Customer would like to manually sort the statuses shown when you click on the Ellipsis Button when viewing Sub-Tasks on their Parent Issue
!SubTask-Statuses.png|thumbnail!

Utilizing the Transition Property {{opsbar-sequence}} to manually sort their Workflow buttons does not seem to apply here. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Use the same {{opsbar-sequence}} configuration manually set on Status Transitions within the Workflow to order the statues. 
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Ability to Manually Order Status Transitions for Sub-Task Issues when Viewed on Parent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46189].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Following instructions to install the Atlassian SDK for centos/red hat does not produce a working installing due to missing files.   


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to [install the SDK|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System]
# go to Centos/Fedora Yum installation
# enter commands as illustrated.  Once you get to this command:  sudo yum install atlassian-plugin-sdk
Note that it checks for dependencies and resolves that it needs to install 'sdk-installer-5.1.9.rpm' from location [rpm stable|http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com/rpm-stable/]  This step fails with a 404 error.


h3. Expected Results
sudo yum install atlassian-plugin-sdk is able to find and install dependencies


h3. Actual Results
404 error and dependencies are not installed


h3.Workaround
There is no workaround, unable to find required file.
fields.summary: Missing dependency in YUM repo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46183].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
- send invitation to new user (do not accept invite)
- assign that user to a group giving access to a specific issue
- navigate to the issue
- click on the watchers to add the new user to the watcher's list for the issue

The error message is:
"""
There was an error adding watcher
The user "Paul" does not have permission to view this issue. This user will not be added to the watch list.
"""

An improved message would be

"""
There was an error adding watcher
The user "Paul" has completed registration. This user will not be added to the watch list.
"""

Because of this error I lost a few minutes trying to understand why I could not do the task (of sharing an issue with Paul)
fields.summary: slightly misleading message concerning new user

fields.description:
Enviroment:
JIRA v6.4.12#64027
Chrome Version 46.0.2490.80 m
Windows 7

Steps to reproduce:
#     click Create to open the create dialogue
#     enter a version into the field Affected Version/s
#     change the issue type

The entered version in Affected Version disappears. You can't enter the version again, because there is no such item in the list. But after finishing the new issue you will see the Version in the field Affected version.

Workaround: Use the latest Version of Firefox or Internet Explorer.

h3. Summary
Status Tooltips do not disappear when using the Issue Status Combo Box, and not explicitly mousing 'out' of the status.

h3. Environment
Any

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues
# Click on issue status combo box
# Hover the mouse on a status
# Wait for tooltip to appear
# Press ESC

h3. Expected Results
The Tooltip should disappear when the Status element is no longer displayed on the screen.

h3. Actual Results
Tooltips remain on the screen

h3. Notes
If not using the ESC button, and mousing out of the status, the tooltip is hidden.
fields.summary: Issue status combo box doesn't clear tooltips

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46156].
  {panel}

This bug is caused by a race condition. 

Steps to reproduce:
Login to JIRA Cloud instance restore a JIRA Backup. Since this is a race condition, we may have to repeat the restore process few times.

In the process of restoring a JIRA backup onto this instance, it had imported the data, it was on the way of disabling/enabling the add-ons, and I hit this stacktrace: https://bitbucket.org/snippets/atlassian/zLr9X

Full log file attached
fields.summary: PICO thread safety race condition on JIRA backup restore in Cloud

fields.description:
When trying to launch JIRA Software 7, the version detection is unable to detect our Java version correctly and stops booting. The error shown is:
{code:java}
*************************************************************************************************************************************
**********     Wrong JVM version! You are running with .. but JIRA requires at least 1.8 to run.      **********
*************************************************************************************************************************************
{code}
The version is named as "..", which obviously seems to be a detection issue.
We also tried to set the JAVA_HOME environment variable, which didn't make any change.
fields.summary: JIRA Software should detect the Java version correctly

fields.description:
h2. Summary
I am unable to edit existing comments in a JIRA 7 Service Desk ticket, with the error "Failed to attach files ... You do not have permission to create attachments for this issue."

I'm logged in as the JIRA Administrator, am the Project Owner/lead, and am trying to edit a comment I just added (which I can also delete).

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Setup fresh Jira instance with Service Desk
# Use administrator user
# Create Service Desk project
# Revoke "Create Attachments" permission from administrator user for created project
## Go to Permission Scheme for created project
## Remove "Create Attachments" permissions for every role
# Create issue in created project
# Create comment in created issue
# Edit created comment

h3. Expected behaviour
Comment is edited

h3. Actual behaviour
"Failed to attach files" error blocks comment edit.

h2. Workarounds
* Create new comment with corrented content and remove old one.
* Add "Create Attachments" permission for the user
fields.summary: Unable to edit comments - "Failed to attach files" message
Documentation Regarding HSTS Integration With JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46149].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As a JIRA Server User, I would like the ability to use the JIRA Mobile App to access our our system. Native apps are currently available for cloud only and we would like to see this functionality available for JIRA Server.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to connect to JIRA using an Atlassian provided app for Android and iOS.
h3. Workaround

Use the Browser version of JIRA, or try a third party product.

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of August 14, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

I'm excited to announce that we have released public apps Jira Server mobile apps on iOS and Android. 

For more information including functionality available, requirements and sign up details, see here:[  |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/jira-software-mobile-app-966063511.html] [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/mobile-app/server]

If you're interested in JSD on mobile, then please follow this link instead (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-152). I'll post future updates there.

Please do send us feedback, it is crucial in helping us improve our mobile app. 

Thanks, 

James | Product Manager, Server Mobile 
{panel}

Unattended installation needs to be improved and provide more documentation on capability.

fields.summary: encoding issue, JIRA Update check, build 70107
#EANF#
#EANF#

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46073].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When creating sub task from a parent task, it used to copy the fix version from the parent issue. However it is currently not working as of the latest Cloud Release.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a test project
# Create some issues
# Create some version
# Assign fix version to one of the issue
# Create subtask 

h3. Expected Result

Subtask created with Fix Version populated

h3. Actual Result

Subtask created without Fix Version populated, no value is seen in the fix version field.

h3. Workaround

# Enable JIRA Suite Utilities 
# Add post function in the create transition, (select the text mode > select the first step > you will see {{create}} transition on your left)
# Select {{Copy Value From Other Field}}
# Click next, select {{FixVersions}} as the source field and destination, for the option pick {{copy from parent}}
# Publish the workflow
fields.summary: Fix Version is not Copied to Subtask when Creating Subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA user, it is not possible to search for issues that are not on my issue history or returned in my favorite filters when linking an issue through the *Issue Link* system field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Use the same search dialog as it is used in the *More > Link* action to search for issues from the *Issue Link* system field.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use the *More > Link* dialog to search for issues that are not on your history or a favorited filter.
fields.summary: Add search functionality to the Issue Link field
